results.title: Vocational indecision
results.creator_credit: Leanne Beattie, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Leanne Beattie takes us down the long path to finding her ideal career. It is not always something that comes to you during your school years, and maybe not for a long time after that, but sometimes, when you just focus on what you enjoy, eventually you find it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leanne Beattie, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Living in & belonging to a place
results.creator_credit: Barbara Pater, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Barbara Pater provides some insight into what it is like to have an acquired brain injury. Some people want to retreat from the world and some join their local community group but all struggle to restore a sense of dignity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Pater, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Story on purpose
results.creator_credit: Kaylene Tyler, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In a sad reflection on the death of her older brother, Kaylene Tyler remembers the times they spent together when they were children. What reverberates is the sense of waste when a life is taken too soon, when the depths of potential has failed to be realised.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kaylene Tyler, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: In a sad reflection on the death of her older brother, Kaylene Tyler remembers the times they spent together when they were children. What reverberates is the sense of waste when a life is taken too soon, when the depths of potential has failed to be realised.

results.title: Safe harbours
results.brief_description: Herself an immigrant, Karen Adams reflects on how policies and attitudes have changed towards immigrants and, in particular, refugees. A memorial at Otaki reminds her of the potential for hospitality and the dangerous journey that refugees take in the desperate search for safe harbours.
results.description: Herself an immigrant, Karen Adams reflects on how policies and attitudes have changed towards immigrants and, in particular, refugees. A memorial at Otaki reminds her of the potential for hospitality and the dangerous journey that refugees take in the desperate search for safe harbours.
description_for_label: Herself an immigrant, Karen Adams reflects on how policies and attitudes have changed towards immigrants and, in particular, refugees. A memorial at Otaki reminds her of the potential for hospitality and the dangerous journey that refugees take in the desperate search for safe harbours.

results.title: My ambitions
results.creator_credit: David Clune, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Since David Clune first travelled to Japan at 16, he developed a thirst for travel that has never been quenched. In all his travels, he has witnessed suffering amongst the beauty and it has encouraged in him a desire to make a difference, even though he is content in Australia…for now.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Clune, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

In all his travels, he has witnessed suffering amongst the beauty and it has encouraged in him a desire to make a difference, even though he is content in Australia…for now.

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (September 2007)
results.creator_credit: Terry Melvin, Robyn Colls, Maria McCarthy, Laura Brearley, David Clune, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Life changing events, the experience of Italian immigrants, tributes to loved ones. These four digital stories, created by members of the public and facilitated by ACMI staff, are a biographical record of things closest to the hearts of the participants.

results.title: May's early days
results.creator_credit: Robyn Colls, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Through Robyn’s tribute to the life and experiences of her mother, May, she gives us some insight of a spirited woman and her connection with the region in which she grew up.

results.title: Kalihgat
results.creator_credit: Terry Melvin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Terry Melvin recalls a cathartic event from his youth, when he travelled as a university student to India. In Calcutta, he worked in a hospice for the dying and destitute and tells of the experiences that have shaped and haunted the person his is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Melvin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Terry Melvin recalls a cathartic event from his youth, when he travelled as a university student to India. In Calcutta, he worked in a hospice for the dying and destitute and tells of the experiences that have shaped and haunted the person his is today.

results.title: Italian settlement in the Yarra Valley
results.creator_credit: Maria McCarthy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Maria McCarthy recalls the stories from her youth, the ones told about her families’ voyage from Italy to Australia and settling in the Yarra Valley. She tells of her parents’ adoption of a new culture and way of life and the legacy of those decisions on the present.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maria McCarthy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Maria McCarthy recalls the stories from her youth, the ones told about her families’ voyage from Italy to Australia and settling in the Yarra Valley. She tells of her parents’ adoption of a new culture and way of life and the legacy of those decisions on the present.
